agency_name: HABITAT FOR HUMANITY OF NORTHEAST INDIANA
agency_desc: A nonprofit Christian housing ministry that builds and renovates affordable housing for qualified individuals and families.
site_name: HABITAT FOR HUMANITY OF NORTHEAST INDIANA
service_description: Builds and rehabilitates homes for eligible low-income persons in DeKalb, Noble, and Steuben County. Participants contribute a set number of hours of labor ("sweat equity") toward the construction of a dwelling that they may then purchase through a zero-interest, low monthly payment loan. Volunteer opportunities are also available for interested individuals and service groups.
site_details: Call for information or visit website to complete the pre-application.
site_eligibility: Household income between 30%-80% of area median income -- Able to make payments (steady employment history or equivalent income) -- Currently have reasonably good credit

agency_desc: A public library that provides access to fiction and non-fiction library materials to patrons of all ages.
service_description: Maintains a public lending library and provides phone-based reference assistance. In-house services include public computer and Internet access.
site_details: Walk in to apply for a library card, check out materials, or use in-house services. Call for information.
site_eligibility: Most in-house services, including computer stations: Open -- For a library card: Reside or own property in the city of Butler in DeKalb County

agency_desc: A nonprofit pregnancy resource center that offers limited medical services such as pregnancy testing, first trimester ultrasounds and STD testing for women. We also offer pregnancy and parenting support services, education and resources.
service_description: Offers pregnancy testing and written verification, counseling on abortion alternatives, referrals to pregnancy and parenting assistance resources, and post-abortion support. All services are provided from a pro-life perspective.
site_details: Walk-ins, or call to make an appointment. Must complete an intake form
site_schedule: Mon noon-7pm; Tues and Wed noon-5pm; Thurs 10am-5pm
site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: A nonprofit pregnancy resource center that offers limited medical services such as pregnancy testing, first trimester ultrasounds and STD testing for women. We also offer pregnancy and parenting support services, education and resources.
service_description: Offers ultrasounds to individuals who are pregnant, determines viability and age of pregnancy.
site_details: Walk-ins welcome or call to schedule an intake appointment.
site_schedule: Mon noon-7pm; Tues and Wed noon-5pm; Thurs 10am-5pm
site_eligibility: First trimester of pregnancy

agency_desc: A nonprofit pregnancy resource center that offers limited medical services such as pregnancy testing, first trimester ultrasounds and STD testing for women. We also offer pregnancy and parenting support services, education and resources.
service_description: Provides an incentive program that encourages pregnant women and new parents to access parenting education, health care, and related services. Participants earn coupons  ("Dollars") through this agency and partnering schools, clinics, doctors, and social service agencies. Coupons can be redeemed for maternity and baby supplies (such as diapers, formula, infant and toddler clothing, maternity clothing, cribs, high chairs, and strollers).
site_details: Walk in or call ahead to arrange a time to come; must complete an intake form.
site_schedule: Mon noon-7pm; Tues and Wed noon-5pm; Thurs 10am-5pm
site_eligibility: Pregnant women, women and or men with children age 3 or younger

Coupons can be redeemed for maternity and baby supplies (such as diapers, formula, infant and toddler clothing, maternity clothing, cribs, high chairs, and strollers).
site_details: Walk in or call ahead to arrange a time to come; must complete an intake form.
site_schedule: Mon noon-7pm; Tues and Wed noon-5pm; Thurs 10am-5pm
site_eligibility: Pregnant women, women and or men with children age 3 or younger

agency_desc: A nonprofit pregnancy resource center that offers limited medical services such as pregnancy testing, first trimester ultrasounds and STD testing for women. We also offer pregnancy and parenting support services, education and resources.

agency_desc: A nonprofit pregnancy resource center that offers limited medical services such as pregnancy testing, first trimester ultrasounds and STD testing for women. We also offer pregnancy and parenting support services, education and resources.
service_description: Provides emergency assistance with diapers and baby formula for new parents in need. Clients may receive up to 12 diapers per month on an emergency basis. Other material assistance is available for families in crisis, such as a house fire or fleeing a domestic violent situation.
site_details: Walk in.
site_schedule: Mon noon-7pm; Tues and Wed noon-5pm; Thurs 10am-5pm
site_eligibility: Parents of children age 3 or younger -- Limit one visit (12 diapers) per month (additional assistance may be earned through the Helping Hands incentive program)

agency_desc: An elected official responsible for administering the township, including such duties as providing township assistance, burial of the indigent, and maintaining the township budget.
service_description: May be able to assist township residents who are experiencing an unexpected crisis with basic needs, such as:  Essential utilities -- Burial/Cremation expenses -- Housing expense -- Work/Medical transportation -- Food/Clothing -- Necessary medications/medical care assistance is at the discretion of the trustee. Denials can be appealed to the county commissioner; information on appealing is included in the denial letter.

site_eligibility: MUST LIVE IN TOWNSHIP (Visit www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address to discover township.) -- With financial need based on assessment -- Able to provide documentation of income and expenses for all household members

service_description: Provides emergency nonperishable food to people in need. Limited service area.
site_details: Call to register.
site_eligibility: Living in DeKalb County -- Not used pantry in last 30 days

agency_desc: A nonprofit agency that offers a senior community center, a food pantry, local transit, and other supportive services to meet the needs of seniors, disabled persons, and low income families in DeKalb County.
service_description: Offers social and wellness activities, shopping trips, and special events for area seniors. Transportation may be available within set boundaries.
site_details: Walk in or call for information.
site_eligibility: Living in DeKalb County

agency_desc: A nonprofit agency that offers a senior community center, a food pantry, local transit, and other supportive services to meet the needs of seniors, disabled persons, and low income families in DeKalb County.
service_description: Provides curb-to-curb transportation for all residents of DeKalb County. Reservation should be scheduled in advance. Discounted programs may be available for seniors.
site_details: Call to schedule a reservation at least 24 hours prior with the following information: name, phone number, number of people, date/time of appointment and return trip, pick up and destination addresses, need of assistance and/or wheelchair vehicle, and payment method.

service_description: Offers support groups to seniors and their families. Support groups range from a variety of topics.. All meetings take place in the Heimach Center.
site_details: Call for meeting times.
site_eligibility: Seniors and their families

agency_desc: A nonprofit agency that offers a senior community center, a food pantry, local transit, and other supportive services to meet the needs of seniors, disabled persons, and low income families in DeKalb County.
service_description: Provides supplemental food to low-income seniors through a partnership with the United States Department of Agriculture (USDA). Monthly packages including animal protein, plant based protein, fruits, vegetables, starches, milk, grains, and cheese. Participants must pickup package from food bank; delivery to seniors who are medically homebound may also be available. Pre-registration is required.
site_details: Call to complete a phone assessment or visit the website to download an application -- A waiting list is maintained when program is at capacity.
site_eligibility: Living DeKalb County -- Age 60 or older -- With household income at or below 130% of Federal Poverty Level

agency_desc: Provides public health nursing, works to control the spread of communicable disease, investigates environmental hazards, and maintains vital records for the county.
service_description: Works to prevent or control the spread of communicable diseases in the County. Investigates reports of communicable diseases, provides community education programs, and offers public health nursing services.
site_details: Communicable disease investigations are generally referred through hospitals and clinics; call for additional information.
site_eligibility: Varies by service; call for details.

agency_desc: Provides public health nursing, works to control the spread of communicable disease, investigates environmental hazards, and maintains vital records for the county.
service_description: Offers limited adult vaccinations, including tetanus (Tdap), hepatitis A, and hepatitis B.
site_details: Call to schedule an appointment or for availability of walk-in hours.
site_eligibility: Age 19 or older -- Living in DeKalb County

agency_desc: Provides public health nursing, works to control the spread of communicable disease, investigates environmental hazards, and maintains vital records for the county.
service_description: Provides routine health and safety inspections and investigates complaints against restaurants, grocery stores, and other food service establishments in the County. Provides consultation and licensing for retail food service vendors and food safety education for individuals, health fairs, and community groups.
site_details: Call to make a complaint about licensed food service establishments in the County or for details about licensing or food safety programs.

agency_desc: Provides public health nursing, works to control the spread of communicable disease, investigates environmental hazards, and maintains vital records for the county.
service_description: Maintains records of all births and deaths that occur in the County and provides certified copies of birth and death certificates for fixed fees.
site_details: Walk in, download application from website, or call to have application sent by mail. -- Bring or mail in completed application, required documentation, and payment. -- Indiana birth certificates and death records may also be requested online at www.vitalchek.com; this service is offered by a third-party and is not directly affiliated with the health department.
site_eligibility: Births/deaths occurring in the County -- Individual named on the birth certificate, parent, or other adult with a legal right to the certificate

agency_desc: Provides public health nursing, works to control the spread of communicable disease, investigates environmental hazards, and maintains vital records for the county.

site_eligibility: Births/deaths occurring in the County -- Individual named on the birth certificate, parent, or other adult with a legal right to the certificate

agency_desc: Provides public health nursing, works to control the spread of communicable disease, investigates environmental hazards, and maintains vital records for the county.
service_description: Provides low-cost or free immunizations for County youth (through age 18) who are uninsured, whose insurance does not cover the required vaccination, or who are enrolled in Medicaid. Also provides immunizations for American Indians and Alaskan Natives under age 18 regardless of their insurance status.
site_details: Call to schedule an appointment or for availability of walk-in hours.
site_eligibility: Living in withiin the County -- Age 2 months through 18 years -- Without health insurance -OR- insurance does not cover needed vaccine (including coverage that has capped out) -OR- insured through Medicaid -OR- American Indian or Alaskan Native, regardless of insurance status

agency_desc: Provides public health nursing, works to control the spread of communicable disease, investigates environmental hazards, and maintains vital records for the county.
service_description: Provides low-cost tuberculosis (TB) testing to persons required to take the test for work, school, or other programs as well as for those with known exposure or high risk factors.
site_details: Call to schedule an appointment.

agency_desc: Provides public health nursing, works to control the spread of communicable disease, investigates environmental hazards, and maintains vital records for the county.
service_description: Provides inspections, permits, code enforcement, and other services to protect the health and safety of residents. Regulates drainage and septic systems, wells, public swimming pools, tattoo parlors, and food service establishments in the county. Investigates reports of sanitation violations, substandard housing conditions, air or water pollution, and safety hazards posed by vacant buildings. Offers information and referrals regarding household health and environmental hazards such as mold, lead, radon, tap water contamination, mosquitoes, and rodents.
site_details: Call for information, to submit a request, or make a report.
site_eligibility: Varies by service

agency_desc: A nonprofit agency that offers animal care services and shelter for surrender or abandoned animals in DeKalb County.
service_description: Accepts donations of pet food and supplies for shelter use. Needed items dry and wet cat/dog food, cat litter, and cleaning supplies. Volunteers to assist with shelter duties, including yard work, facility maintenance, dog walking, and fundraising are also welcome.

site_eligibility: To Volunteer: Age 16 or older and at least 18 years of age to walk dog -- Signed Volunteer Form

agency_desc: A nonprofit agency that offers animal care services and shelter for surrender or abandoned animals in DeKalb County.
service_description: Provides shelter for stray and unwanted animals in DeKalb County and rehomes animals through adoption. Offers lost-and-found services and microchipping of pets.

site_eligibility: To Adopt: Open subject to review by staff  -- Must have income -- Must be physically capable of taking care of a pet -- With an approved application -- To Surrender: Call to check availability

agency_desc: County veterans service officers are veterans employed by the county to act as liaisons with county residents for veteran issues, including but not limited to; providing forms, information, and assistance in obtaining state and federal veterans benefits.
service_description: Provides information about and assistance with veterans' benefits to veterans, their surviving spouses, and their children. County service officers can assist in the completion and submission of forms necessary to receive all appropriate federal and state veterans' benefits.
site_details: Call to schedule an appointment.
site_eligibility: Veteran -- surviving spouses --children of a veteran

agency_desc: An elected official responsible for administering the township, including such duties as providing township assistance, burial of the indigent, and maintaining the township budget.
service_description: May be able to assist township residents who are experiencing an unexpected crisis with basic needs, such as:  Essential utilities -- Burial/Cremation expenses -- Housing expense -- Work/Medical transportation -- Food/Clothing -- Necessary medications/medical care assistance is at the discretion of the trustee. Denials can be appealed to the county commissioner; information on appealing is included in the denial letter.
site_details: Confirm correct Trustee by visiting www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address; township is shown as "county subdivision". -- Confirm correct Trustee by visiting www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address; township is shown as "county subdivision". -- Call to schedule an appointment.
site_eligibility: MUST LIVE IN TOWNSHIP (Visit www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address to discover township.) -- With financial need based on assessment -- Able to provide documentation of income and expenses for all household members

agency_desc: An elected official responsible for administering the township, including such duties as providing township assistance, burial of the indigent, and maintaining the township budget.
service_description: May be able to assist township residents who are experiencing an unexpected crisis with basic needs, such as:  Essential utilities -- Burial/Cremation expenses -- Housing expense -- Work/Medical transportation -- Food/Clothing -- Necessary medications/medical care assistance is at the discretion of the trustee. Denials can be appealed to the county commissioner; information on appealing is included in the denial letter.

site_details: Confirm correct Trustee by visiting www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address; township is shown as "county subdivision". -- Confirm correct Trustee by visiting www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address; township is shown as "county subdivision". -- Call to schedule an appointment.
site_eligibility: MUST LIVE IN TOWNSHIP (Visit www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address to discover township.) -- With financial need based on assessment -- Able to provide documentation of income and expenses for all household members

agency_desc: An elected official responsible for administering the township, including such duties as providing township assistance, burial of the indigent, and maintaining the township budget.
service_description: May be able to assist township residents who are experiencing an unexpected crisis with basic needs, such as:  Essential utilities -- Burial/Cremation expenses -- Housing expense -- Work/Medical transportation -- Food/Clothing -- Necessary medications/medical care assistance is at the discretion of the trustee. Denials can be appealed to the county commissioner; information on appealing is included in the denial letter.

service_description: Responds during a disaster or large-scale emergency in DeKalb County, assists with the recovery efforts afterwards, and takes steps to prevent or lessen the effects of future disasters. Offers sandbags to DeKalb County households during times of flooding.

agency_desc: Northeastern Center helps individuals in northeastern Indiana achieve emotional and mental wholeness through accessible, affordable and quality behavioral health services.
service_description: Provides an acute, inpatient unit for adults experiencing a mental health crisis. Chemical detoxification services may be available. Visitation is contingent on a client's condition.
taxonomy_category: Mental Health and Substance Use Disorder Services
site_details: For admission, walk in for initial assessment. For visitation, walk in during visiting hours and provide the patient's code number. Number of visitors is at the discretion of the charged nurse.
site_eligibility: In need of inpatient mental health or addictions treatment (based on assessment) -- Age 18 and older

agency_desc: Provides law enforcement, crime investigation, crime prevention, emergency assistance, and other police duties for the city of Auburn in DeKalb County.
service_description: Provides law enforcement, crime investigation, crime prevention, emergency assistance, and other police duties for the city of Auburn in DeKalb County. Persons in need of emergency assistance should call 9-1-1.
site_details: Call 9-1-1 for emergency assistance. For nonemergency services, call the office.
site_eligibility: Open; serves the city of Auburn in DeKalb County

agency_desc: A crisis pregnancy organization that provides support and resources to help women in need carry their pregnancies to term.
service_description: Provides diapers, baby clothing (up to size 5T), and maternity clothing for new and expectant mothers in need. Items are available to clients who attend parenting classes in order to earn coupons for use at Crib Club where they can be redeemed for baby items. Maternity clothing is available without participating in the classes.
site_details: Call to schedule an intake appointment.
site_eligibility: Pregnant women and mothers or fathers of children age 5 or younger

Maternity clothing is available without participating in the classes.

agency_desc: A crisis pregnancy organization that provides support and resources to help women in need carry their pregnancies to term.
service_description: Provides parenting and childbirth education programs for parents and expectant parents. Participants earn coupons that can be redeemed at Crib Club for baby and maternity items. Classes are available in-person as well as online zoom classes.
site_details: Call to schedule an intake appointment or to find out about upcoming classes.
site_eligibility: Pregnant women and parents of children age 5 or younger

agency_desc: A crisis pregnancy organization that provides support and resources to help women in need carry their pregnancies to term.

site_eligibility: Pregnant women and parents of children age 5 or younger

agency_desc: A crisis pregnancy organization that provides support and resources to help women in need carry their pregnancies to term.
service_description: Provides a one-time assistance for baby formula during emergencies for families with infants. Recurring assistance is available for those participating in other services at this location.
site_details: Call to schedule a pick-up for baby formula during emergencies.
site_eligibility: With an infant in the household on supplemental feeding -- In emergency or first time seeking assistance from this agency for baby formula

agency_desc: A crisis pregnancy organization that provides support and resources to help women in need carry their pregnancies to term.
service_description: Provides free, walk-in pregnancy testing, pregnancy verification required for medical benefits, and referrals to prenatal care, adoption agencies, and other abortion alternatives for women facing a crisis pregnancy. No referrals are made to abortion service providers.
site_details: Walk-ins accepted; calling ahead is recommended.
site_eligibility: Women

agency_desc: A crisis pregnancy organization that provides support and resources to help women in need carry their pregnancies to term.
service_description: Offers ultrasounds to individuals who are pregnant, determines viability and age of pregnancy.
site_details: Call to schedule an appointment.
site_eligibility: First trimester of pregnancy

agency_desc: A faith-based, nonprofit organization providing transitional housing to women in need.
service_description: Provides faith-based, transitional housing for women experiencing homelessness due to domestic abuse, pregnant without any support, or struggling to overcome addiction. Offers case management, meals, and support to achieve and maintain self-sufficiency. Six to nine month stay required in this dormitory-style living facility.
site_details: Call for an intake assessment.
site_eligibility: Women -- Age 18 or over -- Must agree to follow rules of the program and be committed to stay 6-9 months

agency_desc: A church offering worship services and charitable outreach programs, including a food pantry.
service_description: Provides perishable and nonperishable food to people in need.
site_details: Walk in.
site_schedule: Monthly last Wed 5pm-7pm  (moves up a week in Sept, Nov, and Dec -- Halloween may impact) -- check church doors for update signs
site_eligibility: Living in DeKalb County - Eastern school district and Franklin Township

agency_desc: A faith-based organization that serves the community with a food pantry, clothing distribution, and emergency relief during the holidays.
service_description: Offers limited emergency financial assistance for people in need of paying rent, gas, electric, water, prescriptions, and expenses for medical transportation. No assistance with deposits or re connection fees.
site_details: Walk in or visit the website to complete intake forms.
site_schedule: Tues and Thurs 2pm-4pm or by appointment.

agency_desc: A nonprofit organization providing free primary medical and dental services to uninsured residents.
service_description: Provides a primary care health clinic for uninsured persons of all ages in need. Services may include acute and chronic health services, prescription assistance, diabetes management, smoking cessation classes, laboratory test, and limited mental health referrals. Eye care is offered by appointment, when available.
site_details: For existing clients: Call to schedule an appointment. -- For new clients: Walk-ins are accepted during designated hours; arrive at least two hours before closing. -- DURING COVID-19 CRISIS: Call to schedule an appointment.
site_schedule: Mon 9am-noon and 1pm-4pm; Tues 9am-noon and 1pm-4pm; Wed 9am-1pm; Thurs 3pm-8pm
site_eligibility: Uninsured, underinsured at or below 200% of Federal Poverty Level
